article.headline: Pacific 92, Lewis &amp, Clark 47
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. (AP) -- Anthony Brown had 16 points and 11 rebounds to lead Pacific to a 92-47 rout of Lewis & Clark College on Saturday night in the Tigers' home opener. Steffan Johnson had 14 points and six assists for Pacific, which blitzed Lewis & Clark 55-14 in the second half after trailing by eight points late in the first half. Chad Troyer scored 11 points for the Tigers (3-1), who made 61 percent of their field-goal attempts and had 10 players score five points or more. Thomas Tillery scored a game-high 17 points to lead Lewis & Clark (1-1), which is ranked No. 21 nationally in Division III. Tillery's floater in the lane brought the Pioneers within 46-39 early in the second half, but Lewis & Clark then went more than 13 minutes before scoring another basket. Pacific went on runs of 14-1 and 17-0 during that span to turn the game into a blowout. Lewis & Clark made 7 of 15 three-point shots in the first half and moved out to a 31-23 lead after Joey Toboni made his third trey with 4:30 to play before the intermission. But C.J. Morgan and Johnson answered with back-to-back 3-pointers, Michael Nunnally followed with a dunk to tie the score and Pacific finished the half with a 14-2 run to take a 37-33 lead at the break. Troyer began the second half with a jump-shot and two 3-pointers, sending Pacific on its way to the lopsided victory.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
